result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander J Bilodeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Gregory Rudolph in the amount of $13,080--joint and several
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

3/11/16: The Court finds that over the course of Probation Mr. Bilodeau has the ability to pay the full amount of restitution that has been ordered.
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

--Criminal Thinking Course as determined by Agent
--to partake in a Parenting Class
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--no contact with Sawyer Wallace

The Court grants Mr. Bilodeau expungement upon successful completion of Probation

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF175 and 15CF173 called together at 10:02am [mo]
[Hearing on Determination of Ability to Pay]
No appearance by either defendant or counsel for defendants
ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek, Ms. Madison, Mr. Bilodeau, and Atty. Scholz enter the courtroom at 10:04am

Ms. Madison sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Atty. Svehlek
--Cross examination by ADA Hall
--questioning by the Court

Mr. Bilodeau sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Atty. Scholz
--Cross examination by ADA Hall
--questioning by the Court

Arguments given by Atty. Svehlek

ADA Hall cites case law re: ability to pay

Arguments given by Atty. Scholz

The Court adopts as to each Defendant the work history that they have testified.
The Court makes findings as to Defendant's earning abilities

The Court finds that over the course of Probation Ms. Madison has the ability to pay $13, 270
The Court finds that over the course of Probation Mr. Bilodeau has the ability to pay the full amount of restitution that has been ordered. 

The JOC should reflect the numbers cited by the Court as the Defendant's ability to pay(if there is a place for the ability to pay on JOC, otherwise the courts order on this record should stand)

recess: 11:00am
to Victim - per 1/4/16 Order to Disburse.
Payment hearing at 03-11-2016 10:00 am
in the amount of $1500
Proposed order to disburse
with attached criminal case settlement and elements

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form & attachments

Case called at 11:00am [mo]
Defendant Alexander J Bilodeau in court with Attorney Amy C Scholz.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Arguments given by ADA Hall in favor of Amending Charge.
--The Court grants the State leave to Amend the Charge as stated in the Criminal Case Settlement.
--The Court strikes the 939.62(1)(b), repeater enhancer as it does not apply to Mr. Bilodeau

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on the Amended Charge; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court orders that the State, Atty. Scholz and Counsel for Ms. Madison (Atty. Svehlek) confer with the Court's JA to schedule a hearing for ability to pay, the scheduling of this hearing is to occur within 10 days; the hearing on ability to pay is to occur within 90 days. 

On the Amended Charge, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--Criminal Thinking Course as determined by Agent
--to partake in a Parenting Class
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--no contact with Sawyer Wallace
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution to Gregory Rudolph in the amount of $13,080--joint and several
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay $608 in extradiction fees

Days credit for time already served:  30  days
The Court grants Mr. Bilodeau expungement upon successful completion of Probation
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given
recess: 11:31am

NEXT: Ability to Pay Hearing to be scheduled by Counsel
Status conference at 12-29-2015 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 11-11-2015 10:20 am
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:34pm [mo]
Defendant Alexander J Bilodeau in court with Attorney Amy Scholz on behalf of Attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  ADA Monica Hall  appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Bilodeau waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--No demand for speedy trial
recess: 2:40am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/11/15 at 10:20am   (2) Status Conference on 12/29/15 at 10:00am
Preliminary hearing at 10-19-2015 02:30 pm
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF175 and 15CF173 called at 9:02am [mo]
Co-Defendant Andria K Madison in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. 
Co-Defendant Alexander Bilodeau in court with Attorney Patricia Padurean

ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both files

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Discovery has been received and has further investigation to conduct.
Atty. Svehlek requests that the Court address Ms. Madison's letter requesting bond modification.
Atty. Svehlek orally that bond be modified to a signature bond, with same non-monetary conditions; gives argument in favor of bond modification. 
ADA Shock indicates that he was unaware that this motion was being brought before the Court at this time; objects on basis of timing and no motion filed.
The Court grants the State's objection; Atty. Svehlek is to file a written Notice and Motion for Bond Modification and schedule a hearing with the Court's JA.

Atty. Padurean indicates that Discovery has been receieved and has further investigation to conduct
Atty. Padurean indicates that Defense has filed a Motion for Bail Modification; gives argument.
--ADA Shock does not object to the Bond Modification

On 9/15/15: The Court amends Mr. Bilodeau's to include the exception that Mr. Bilodeau may discuss with Ms. Madison pre-natal care regarding their child and their child's future post-delivery. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates that a Prelim Waiver occurred in Ms. Madison's case
Atty. Padurean indicates that a Preliminary Hearing has NOT occurred in Mr. Bilodeau's case.
recess in case 15CF175: 9:18am
recess in case 15CF173: 9:18am

Cases 15CF173 and 15CF177 called together at 9:42am
Co-Defendant Alexander Bilodeau in court with Attorney Patricia Padurean
Co- Defendant Sawyer J Wallace in court with Attorney David Makovec

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:48am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on Cases 15CF173 and 15CF177 on 10/19/15 at 2:30pm; Case 15CF175 to follow as Status Conference

Case called at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Alexander J Bilodeau appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Patricia M. Padurean. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $1500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Gregory Rudolph or co-actors - Andria Madison or Sawyer Wallace 
-No presence at N6723 Waldmann Ln. Town of Farmington
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescriptions as prescribed
-Not engage in any exchanges of metal or scrappings for money
Recess: 1:52 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 8/26/15 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 9/15/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
